quest.name: A Glimpse of Madness
journal: It is not often that the Liberation Front guard welcomes heroes from distant lands, but he is doing his best to compose himself.
objectives: Speak with the Liberation Front guard.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: I...I require but a moment to catch my breath...

dialogue.name: RESSIANGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: You are Forename Surname, are you not? We were told of your coming.

dialogue.name: RESSIANGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Heroes of Eorzea, we of the Doman Liberation Front are honored to receive you. If you would be so good as to follow me...

dialogue.name: RESSIANGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: ...Is aught amiss? Pray come inside!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Enter the House of the Fierce?

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Though our resources are limited, our stronghold is secure. You may rest and recover here in safety.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: To think that warriors such as you journeyed across the seas to aid our cause... We cannot thank you enough!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As you can see, they went to great lengths to disable the aetheryte. Apparently, in the twilight days of the rebellion, they feared that Zenos would be willing to risk sending unattuned conscripts.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That said, it is hardly irreversible. They have the necessary materials. It would be a challenge to repair it alone, but mayhap with my brother's help...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Moenbryda could have done it with her eyes closed. What little Alphinaud and I know of aetheryte technology, we learned from her when she came to visit Grandfather.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Mayhap a brief respite is in order. Were I twenty years younger, these wounds would not warrant a second glance. Alas, no samurai has the strength to defeat that villain Old Age.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: But what say you to the House of the Fierce? Compared to your Rising Stones, I concede it may seem somewhat lacking...

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: But it has been a haven these past ten years to all who would set Doma free.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Regrettably, our efforts in that time have come to little and less...

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: <sigh> When the Emperor died, we were so sure the hour of our liberation was at hand. But Zenos soon put paid to that, with the aid of Yotsuyu and the secrets she sold.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Before the might of the XIIth Legion, our forces were as cattle to be slaughtered. Not even the shinobi escaped their wrath. Yet somehow our sanctuary remained undiscovered, and we few lived to fight another day.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You should hear this, Forename. He was just telling me about Zenos and the rebellion.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: What you have to understand is that it was not a simple matter of numbers. The bulk of the XIIth never even took the field. It was Zenos's stratagems that won the war. They were unlike anything we had ever seen.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: His formations were unorthodox─bewildering. We honestly thought we had him on the back foot. One moment we were pressing home our advantage, the next we were surrounded and at his mercy.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: And then he stood before us, his cornered prey. Alone and unarmed. He beckoned us to come forward and fight for our lives.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: One by one, my comrades charged. Fearless and unflinching, he would dance amidst their blades for a time, and then draw close, as if to embrace...

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: One...after...another. He made us watch. Do you understand? He made us watch.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: What kind of monster enjoys killing people?

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: ...I do not think there was any joy in it. Nor justice, nor morality, nor meaning. To him, the weight of one life is no different from that of a thousand.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: A challenge had been issued and was accepted. But on finding us no challenge at all, his objective changed.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: There were tales of imperial soldiers being flayed for slaughtering families. For breaking brave men's spirits. Only later did I come to understand why. He did not desire obedience. He desired hate...and men consumed by it.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text:
A new battle. A new enemy. A new challenge.
The hunt, I am told he called it. A hunt without end.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text:
And when all our best lay dead and broken, he left.
He left, muttering that we had “bored” him.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: But our weapons, at least, held his interest. For he took a fallen samurai's sword, having grown...fond of it.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: Since that day, he has ever wielded Far Eastern blades. He is said to be fascinated by ones with storied histories, and so soldiers who seek to curry his favor often present those of defeated enemies as gifts.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It's like it's all a game to him. People are suffering─dying─and he's collecting swords?

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: ...We all feel the same. But my lady, you must understand...

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: On the battlefield, reasons do not matter. The victor is not the just, but the strong, and the strong become the heroes of the tale. We were not strong enough.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE02492
dialogue.text: It is not sufficient to be right. To be just. Without strength, our path has but one end...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: If it's strength we need, then it's strength we'll get. We can't lose to him again...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Forename. I do hope you have taken this opportunity to rest and recover.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: It is well that you spoke with one of the survivors of that massacre. To defeat one's foe, one must first understand his true nature.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: As the Ala Mhigan Resistance has struggled, so too has the Doman Liberation Front. More so, perhaps, given the precarious position in which we find ourselves in the wake of our doomed rebellion.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: We are few, and our enemies legion. We are weak, and they strong. Yet with your help, I believe that there is little we cannot achieve... I only hope the depth of our predicament has not shaken your commitment to our cause.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Never. Victory will be ours!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No, no. I relish the challenge.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Not so long as I can expect a suitably generous reward.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Aye, that it will. With the hero of Eorzea on our side, we cannot lose!

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: You...relish the thought of facing that monster again? But of course─the hero of Eorzea fears no foe!

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: ...Of course. It may take time, but rest assured you will receive due compensation.
